H0.text: Environmental degradation is the term that identifies the process where scientists alter the hereditary material in corn plants so the plants produce more corn.

H1.text: Ecological succession is the term that identifies the process by which scientists alter the hereditary material in corn plants so the plants produce more corn.

H2.text: Natural selection is the process by which scientists alter the hereditary material in corn plants so the plants produce more corn.

H3.text: Genetic engineering is the process by which scientists alter the hereditary material in corn plants so the plants produce more corn.

A4.text: Genetic engineering is the modification and manipulation of an organism's genes using technology.

A5.text: Humans have altered the genomes of species for thousands of years through selective breeding, or artificial selection as contrasted with natural selection.
